channel.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?
channel.description: i currently have a landline, from bell about, $53 a month, for two features, got it when they had a promoting for $25. now i am thinking about switching to voip, where i can get internet (5mbps down) and a voip phone with all the features for $56 (40 for first 3 months). now although the deal seems very good there are some problems. The 911 feature is a little bit wiered, where you have to tell everything so the emergency team can come to you, also if there is a poweroutage or a disconnection to the internet, the phone won't work, so no 911. now for the poweroutage i am ok i have backup power source running, but i am not so sure about the disconnection caused by their server. In the neighbourhood i live, i really need to have 911 aviable 24/7, majority of the chances if i get stabed or shot and can't speak i would have to just diall 911, but this is a problem with voip. does anyone know any good voip services and are they reliable. btw the $60 is by distrabutal

item.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

my house runs on voip, something like $10 a month.
if your power goes out, use a cellphone??

Read full topic

i woudln’t say just them

item.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:

black = unemployed = too much time = boredom = drugs/crime = police = cover up = basketball

I am no racist!

item.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:6, topic:310801”]my house is moniterd although its still bad, everynight a police car goes infront of my house, just making sure everything is ok. its not really a ghetto, it turned out 2 years ago when a nike sponsored basket ball court was placed right in front of my house, walking time = 30seconds, just cross the street. most people moved after that, but i don’t think i can lol. work is near by and uni is near by, so yea. i really need the 911 lol. i do have a cell but i don’t think i’ll be running to look for the cell @ home if somethings up.[/quote]If I understood correctly, you’re saying that because of the basket ball court your area is crowded with black people?

Read full topic

item.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?

my house is moniterd although its still bad, everynight a police car goes infront of my house, just making sure everything is ok. its not really a ghetto, it turned out 2 years ago when a nike sponsored basket ball court was placed right in front of my house, walking time = 30seconds, just cross the street. most people moved after that, but i don’t think i can lol. work is near by and uni is near by, so yea. i really need the 911 lol. i do have a cell but i don’t think i’ll be running to look for the cell @ home if somethings up.

item.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy

Dude what’s up with freaking out about 911? Not like a plane is gonna crash into your house anytime soon.

item.title: VOIP Vs Landlines?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Live in the UK, where VOIP providers have to make location information available to emergency service providers wherever technically feasible (and they have your address, presumably, so…)

Read full topic

item.description:

Use a mobile when in an emergency. If you cant, your fucked.
